channel.title: The National Radio Company of Ukraine
channel.copyright: Copyright 2010 - The National Radio Company of Ukraine

item.title: Ukrainian saber women win silver medals in Paris
item.description: Ukrainian saber women have claimed silver medals in team competitions at the World Fencing Championships in Paris, France.

item.title: Nuclear reactor No.1 at Khmelnytsky NPP connected to energy grid
item.description: Nuclear reactor No.1 at Khmelnytsky Nuclear Power Plant has been connected to the energy grid after scheduled repairs, the press service of the national nuclear energy generating company Energoatom has reported.

item.title: Foreign currency falls in price at exchange offices
item.description: The average purchase rate of cash dollar in Ukrainian banks fell by 0.04 kopecks on Wednesday compared to Tuesday, to UAH 7.9592/USD 1, while the sale rate of the U.S. currency dropped by 0.24 kopecks, to UAH 7.9878/USD 1.

item.title: Official currency exchange rates
item.description: The National Bank of Ukraine (NBU) set official currency exchange rates for November 10, 2010 at UAH 7.9107/USD 1 (-), UAH 11.031471/EUR 1 (+) and UAH 2.5633/RUB 10 (-).

item.title: Dairy producers cut cheese prices by 10-20%
item.description: The Union of Dairy Enterprises has said that producers have reduced the prices of cheese by 10-20%, Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Union Vadym Chaharovsky has said.

item.title: Ukrainian internet numbering 9.5m users
item.description: According to research monthly carried out and published by Internet-portal I.UA, in October, the number of Ukrainian Internet users grew by 4.83% and reached 9.55 million users.

item.title: Festival of Contemporary Korean Cinema kicks off in Kyiv
item.description: The Festival of Contemporary Korean Cinema will take place in the Kyiv Cinema from November 10 to November 15.

item.title: WB estimates energy sector annual need at USD 3.5bln and ready to allocate USD 200mln in 2011
item.description: The need in investments to the energy sector of Ukraine makes up USD 3.5 billion a year, World Bank's representative in Ukraine Astrid Manroth told the International Investment Forum on energy efficiency and alternative power engineering in Kyiv.

item.title: Gold price up
item.description: The National Bank of Ukraine (NBU) set the official exchange rates of precious metals per ten troy ounces as of November 10, 2010 at UAH 112,035 (!) for gold, UAH 2,259 (+) for silver, and UAH 140,810 (-) for platinum.

item.title: Land price near Kyiv continues falling
item.description: In a period of November 1-8, land plots for cottage construction in Kyiv region dropped in price by 0.33% (USD 13) t–æ USD 3,980 per one hundred sq m.

item.title: International forum to combat nuclear terrorism will be held in Ukraine
item.description: The Fifth International Forum on nuclear security and measures to combat nuclear terrorism will be held on November 16-18 in Kyiv, MFA representative Oleksandr Dikusarov has said.

item.title: Azarov: GDP to grow by 5% in ten months
item.description: Ukraine's gross domestic product (GDP) will grow by 5% in the first ten months of 2010, Prime Minister Mykola Azarov said, while opening a government meeting on Wednesday.

item.title: Trading on interbank market opens at UAH 7.957-7.964/USD 1
item.description: Trading in the U.S. dollar on Ukraine's interbank currency market on Wednesday opened at UAH 7.957-7.964/USD 1.

item.title: Azarov: Gas price formula not meeting market conditions
item.description: The formula for determining the price of Russian gas for Ukraine is not meeting market conditions, Ukrainian Prime Minister Mykola Azarov said, while opening a government meeting on Wednesday.

item.title: EU renews confidence in Ukraine
item.description: The European Union renewed confidence in Ukraine and again takes it as a very promising partner, Prime Minister Mykola Azarov announced this while opening a government meeting on Wednesday.

item.title: Ukraine and Austria sign memorandum on cooperation in agriculture
item.description: The instrument was signed during the working visit of the Ukrainian delegation headed by Prime Minister Nikolai Azarov to Austria.

item.title: Ukraine interested in intensification of its relations with OPEC
item.description: This is what Ukrainian Prime Minister Mykola Azarov told journalists in Vienna. Prime Minister attributed this initiative of Ukrainian authorities to the fact that Ukraine, except for the production of its own oil, is a potent crude oil transporter.

item.title: Ukrainian language will continue consolidating society, President Yanukovych says
item.description: President Viktor Yanukovych expressed confidence that the Ukrainian language as a precious asset of the people will remain a consolidating force of the society.

item.title: Ukraine ready to cooperate with Europe in joint projects
item.description: This was voiced by Ukrainian Prime Minister Mykola Azarov at the 7th meeting of the Vienna Economic Forum. Mykola Azarov has called on European countries to participate in joint projects with Ukraine, in particular, on the construction of the Chop-Lviv highway.

item.title: Ukraine should refuse from dollar, President of Association of Ukrainian Banks says
item.description: " Now, risks of savings in international currencies increased, therefore in a long-term period it is necessary to refuse from the dollar, Oleksandr Suhoniako, President of the Association of Ukrainian Banks (AUB) has said.

item.title: Public agencies could be banned from creating charitable foundations
item.description: Such an opinion was expressed by Chairman of the State Committee for Entrepreneurship Mykhailo Brodsky."This in fact, is legalized corruption. Officials cannot oblige people to transfer their money to charity accounts for the provision of certain services," he said.

item.title: Analysts predict 11.5% inflation in Ukraine in 2010
item.description: According to Oleksiy Blinov, an analyst at Astrum Investment Management,consumer price index (CPI) in 2010 will grow by 11.5%. In October 2010, the price fluctuations were rather evenly distributed on the key components of the consumer basket.

item.title: UEFA experts again inspecting Ukrainian stadiums
item.description: A team of UEFA experts headed by Director for Stadiums and Security Marc Timmer will inspect the construction and reconstruction of stadiums in Kyiv and Lviv as part of preparations for the European football championship in 2012.

item.title: Exhibition of European artists on poverty opens in Kyiv
item.description: A street exhibition of European artists "By Eyes of Poor Persons: Open Gates of Justice for Me" has opened in Kyiv.The action has been dedicated to support the "Goals of the Millennium Development" (in particular, reduction of poverty twofold by 2015).

item.title: Candidate for Kharkiv mayor post from "Batkivshchyna" Arsen Avakov refused recount of ballots in local elections in Kharkiv
item.description: The relevant ruling was made by Kharkiv Administrative Court of Appeals, which rejected Arsen Avakov's election staff request to prohibit registration of Hennady Kernes as mayor of Kharkiv.

item.title: Qualifying Competition of XII Ukrainian festival "Red Rue" held in Khmelnytsky
item.description: This stage of the XII Ukrainian festival of modern Ukrainian songs and popular music "Red Rue" was attended by 109 participants from different regions of Khmelnytshy region and neighboring Rivne, Ternopil, and Volyn regions.

item.title: Full text of draft Tax Code to appear on parliament's official website on November 11
item.description: This was disclosed by chairman of the Committee on Taxation and Customs Policy Vitaly Homutynnyk, who said that issues making concern of many entrepreneurs today are setttled, particularly the ones linked with presumptive tax for small business.

item.title: Storm warning announced in Kherson region
item.description: As was reported by the Emergency department of the regional state administration, south wind is expected to strengthen in the the region on November 9.

item.title: Day of Ukrainian writing and language marked in Ukraine today
item.description: According to the Orthodox calendar - a day commemorating St Nestor the Chronicler.According to researchers, it is with Nestor the Chronicler that the Ukrainian writing and language begins.

item.title: International photo exhibition With Love to Woman presented in Ukraine
item.description: It has opened in the city of Rivne, presenting works by 69 renowned photographers of Ukraine, Argentina, Bangladesh, Germany, Hungary, India, Israel, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, Romania, Russia, Spain, Sri Lanka and Taiwan.

item.title: Prime Minister Mykola Azarov visiting Austria
item.description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Mykola Azarov is on a visit to the Republic of Austria to attend the 7th Vienna Economic Forum.

item.title: On November 9 Ukrainian radio holds Ukrainian national unity dictation
item.description: This is a unique event, which was launched by the National Radio Company of Ukraine in 2000.

item.title: Kyiv to host calligraphy festival as part of international book fair
item.description: The Manuscriptum festival of calligraphy, font, and book art will take place in Kyiv on November 11-14. Its program foresees the presentation of works by calligraphers and illustrators, the conduct of workshops, creative reports and master-classes, as well as an extended art program.

item.title: 95% of winter crops sown in Ukraine
item.description: As was disclosed by Agrarian Minister Mykola Prysiazhniuk, as many as 8.1 million hectares of winter crops have been sown in Ukraine, 95% of the plan.

item.title: Ukraine to draft medium-term public debt management strategy
item.description: The Cabinet approved the procedure for the preparation of this document designed for three years, and the control over its implementation. The strategy is being developed by the Ministry of Finance in consultation with the Ministry of Economy.

item.title: Results of local elections can be trusted
item.description: This is what deputy head of the Presidential administration Hanna Herman stated in an interview with the weekly Zerkalo week.She said the party in power has not always yielded the expected result and the opposition has won in several regions.

item.title: Premier Azarov says government has no intentions to raise retirement age
item.description: Prime Minister Mykola Azarov assured that according to the Cabinet's plans, the implementation of the Pension reform will be integrated - in three stages.

item.title: IMF in talks on next loan tranche not to insist on raising retirement age for Ukrainian women
item.description: Such an opinion was expressed during a press conference by former economy minister, president of the Center for market reforms Volodymyr Lanovyi.

item.title: Public Days start in Kiev
item.description: In addition to the capital, they will be held in Zhytomyr, Kharkiv, Kherson, Kirovograd and Lutsk. The exhibition was first organized by the Conference of European Justice and Peace Commission in the joint action to fight poverty.

item.title: Kyiv Metro celebrating its 50th anniversary
item.description: It was on November 6 when the first five metro stations - Vokzalna, Universytet, Khreshchatyk, Arsenalna and Dnipro - opened in Ukraine for the first time.Events being organized at the local and state levels are dedicated to this date.

item.title: Kyiv regional governor points to Regions Party's confident victory in elections
item.description: Anatoliy Prysiazhniuk has said he believes that the Regions Party received a confident victory in the elections in Kyiv region.112 international observers confirmed that violations reported in the elections could not in general affect the electoral process.

item.title: Parliament speaker hopes for visa-free regime with EU in year or two
item.description: Verkhovna Rada Chairman Volodymyr Lytvyn has said he hopes that after the signing of the Ukraine-EU Action Plan and its implementation, Ukraine could obtain a visa-free regime with the EU in a year or two. He announced this in an interview with the parliament's Rada TV Channel

item.title: Commission on strengthening democracy to be formed in Ukraine
item.description: Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych signed a decree forming a commission on strengthening democracy and establishing the rule of law- a Ukrainian analogue of the Venice Commission.It was formed as an advisory body, in line with clause 28, Article 106 of the Constitution.

item.title: President congratulates veterans on 67th anniversary of Kyiv's liberation from Nazi invaders
item.description: Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych has congratulated the veterans of the Great Patriotic War (the Second World War) and all residents of Kyiv on the 67th anniversary of the Ukrainian capital's liberation from Nazi invaders

item.title: Chornobyl Heroes memory lane to open in Kyiv
item.description: The Chornobyl Heroes memory lane will open on Chornobylska Street in Kyiv. The bust of seven firefighters-heroes will be erected on the alley.

item.title: Berehovo in Zakarpattia renamed into Beregszasz
item.description: Residents of Berehovo, Zakarpattia region (Ukraine's west), have voted for renaming their city into Beregszasz during local referendum, information from Fedir Shandor, the Head of the Carpathian Polling Research Center, Candidate of Sociological Sciences and Lecturer at the Uzhhorod National University.

item.title: Ukraine ups gas transit to Europe
item.description: Ukraine increased gas transit to Western Europe by 5.99% in January-October 2010 year-on-year, to 76.618 billion cubic meters, the press service of Ukrtransgas has reported.

item.title: Ukraine 8th in UEFA Country Ranking
item.description: After the recent matches played in the Champions League and the Europa League, Ukraine ranks eighth in the updated UEFA Country Ranking based on the performance of its clubs shown over the last five seasons.

item.title: Experts say housing prices to decline 15% by spring 2011
item.description: The prices of secondary real estate in Ukraine will drop by 15% till the spring of 2011, according to Oleksandr Rubanov, president of the Union of Ukrainian Real Estate Experts.

item.title: Cash dollar down, euro - sharply rises
item.description: The average cash dollar purchase rate at Ukrainian banks against Thursday fell by 0.17 kopecks and makes up UAH 7.9591 UAH/USD. The U.S. dollar sale rate is 0.17 kopecks down to 7.9912 UAH/USD.
